title: Rescue by gene swamping as a gene drive deployment strategy (python)
description: Gene drives are genetic constructs that can spread deleterious alleles with potential application to population suppression of harmful species. Given that a gene drive can potentially spill over to other populations or even other species, control measures and fail-safes strategies must be considered. Gene drives are designed to generate a rapid demographic decline, while at the same time generating a dynamic change in the population's genetics. Since these evolutionary and demographic processes are linked and are expected to occur at a similar time-scale during gene drive spread, feedback between these processes may significantly affect the outcome of deployment. To study this feedback and to understand how it affects gene drive spillovers, we developed a gene drive model that combines evolutionary and demographic dynamics in a two-population setting. The model demonstrates how feedback between evolutionary and demographic dynamics can generate additional outcomes to those generated by the evolutionary dynamics alone. We identify an outcome of particular interest, where the short-term suppression of the target population is followed by gene swamping and loss of the gene drive. This outcome could be useful for designing gene drive deployments that temporarily suppress the population, but ultimately do not remain in the population. Using our model, we demonstrate the robustness of this outcome to spillover and to the evolution of resistance, and suggest that it could be used as a fail-safe strategy for gene drive deployment.

input_params.label: s
input_params.name: s
input_params.description: Fitness cost of the gene drive allele

input_params.label: c
input_params.name: c
input_params.description: Conversion rate of heterozygotes to homozygotes (a proportion)

input_params.label: h
input_params.name: h
input_params.description: Dominance of the gene drive allele over the wild type allele

input_params.label: q_1(0)
input_params.name: q1
input_params.description: Initial frequency of the gene drive allele in the target population

input_params.label: q_2(0)
input_params.name: q2
input_params.description: Initial frequency of the gene drive allele in the non-target population

input_params.label: m
input_params.name: m
input_params.description: Migration rate between populations

input_params.label: Repeats
input_params.name: repeats
input_params.description: Number of repeats for stochastic models

input_params.label: Output
input_params.name: output
input_params.description: Whether to output the outcome of the model or calculate m*

input_params.label: d
input_params.name: d
input_params.description: Degree of demographic effects of the gene drive

input_params.label: r_0
input_params.name: r0
input_params.description: Intrinsic growth rate of the population, without the gene drive allele

input_params.label: Mutation rate
input_params.name: mu
input_params.description: Rate of wild type alleles mutating to a resistance allele prior to conversion

input_params.label: NHEJ rate
input_params.name: nhej
input_params.description: Rate of NHEJ events converting gene drive heterozygotes to gene drive/resistance allele heterozygotes, prior to conversion

input_params.label: Outcome
input_params.name: outcome
input_params.description: Outcome for resistance plots

input_params.label: s_b
input_params.name: s_b
input_params.description: Selection coefficient of resistance alleles

input_params.label: K
input_params.name: K
input_params.description: Population carrying capacity

input_params.label: Conversion
input_params.name: conversion
input_params.description: Whether to model gametic conversion or zygotic conversion

input_params.label: Population growth
input_params.name: N_model
input_params.description: The model used for population growth

input_params.label: r_{(s)} formulation
input_params.name: r_s
input_params.description: Equation used for calculating genotype growth rate

input_params.label: Îµ
input_params.name: epsilon
input_params.description: Difference of N_i from K at t=0

input_params.label: Steps
input_params.name: target_steps
input_params.description: Number of steps to run model for
